ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Decide rules
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Noah, I can t figure out how to use the go-through-all-rules mechanism to express two conditions simultaneously - can you give an example of what you mean?

Hi Noah,

I can't figure out how to use the go-through-all-rules mechanism =
to express two conditions simultaneously - can you give an example of what =
you mean?

Thanks,
Steve

On 12/26/2009 at 1:27 PM, Noah Levitt wrote:
> He=
llo Steve,
> 
> http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/deci=
derules/package-summary.html
> <http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/arch=
ive/crawler/deciderules/package-summary.html>
> "Each DecideRule is applied=
 in turn; the last one to
> express a non-PASS preference wins"
> 
> So I t=
hink it will work the way you want if you chain them together one
> after t=
he next.
> 
> Noah
> 
> Steven A Rowe wrote:
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I want to wri=
te decide-rules that reject resources based on two
> conditions: content-le=
ngth and content-type (e.g., text/html resources
> larger than 10MB, and te=
xt/plain resources larger than 100KB), but I
> can't find any way to logica=
lly AND rule subsets together.
> >

s that would achieve what I want?

?
